Package com.mssrchapelier.TigreParser.components.VerbProcessor

Contains the VerbProcessor class, the application's component processing finite verb forms, and the subpackages that it relies on:

  • Paradigm, whose class Paradigm reads finite verb paradigms from the paradigm configuration file and stores its internal representation as a mapping (namely a LinkedHashMap) of unique StemDescription objects (see below) to ArrayLists of ParadigmCell objects;
  • StemDescription, with StemDescription instances representing a combination of the number of consonants in the root (NumRadicals), the root type per Raz 19831 (RootType) and the stem's derivational prefix (DerivPrefix; verb preformative in Raz 1983);
  • Stem, storing representations of actual verb roots (the Root class) and stems (the Stem class); also contains RootListGenerator which generates a list of possible verb roots given a (transliterated and geminated) String.

[1] Raz, S. Tigre Grammar and Texts. Malibu, California, USA: Undena Publications, 1983.
